column1: Households that have lost income due to COVID may apply for food assistance under the CARES Act in @pbcgov until NOV 30th. · 1-2 household members: $400 · 3-4 household members: $800 · 5 or more household members: $1000 Apply at: https://t.co/PBsQupqlCp

Small farmers are some of the hardest hit by COVID-19. I’m cosponsoring the #LocalFarmerAct to target aid directly to local and regional food producers and markets. We have to support our small and mid-sized farms as they cope with the impacts of the coronavirus pandemic.

We have lost almost 250000 lives to COVID with 11M COVID-19 confirmed cases. Yesterday America suffered 1707 deaths in one day hitting highest rate in six months. Please protect yourself and others by following the CDC guidelines: https://t.co/pZr2mrzQmf

@pbcgov is offering FREE COVID-19 testing on Thursday November 19 2020 9:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. at Gaines Park located at 1501 North Australian Avenue. Drive-up/walk-up no appointment necessary find testing sites at: https://t.co/AohkApdS89

As COVID-19 surges across the country it remains crucial to wear a mask & social distance: • Wear masks with two or more layers to stop the spread of COVID-19 • Wear the mask over your nose & mouth & secure it under your chin • Masks should be worn by people two years & older

Once again @realdonaldtrump has failed to take COVID seriously or follow public health guidance. I am praying for a speedy recovery for the 133 Secret Service agents who were either infected or exposed to COVID-19 due to Trump’s travel & rallies. https://t.co/VPEa2DiiZt
Don’t miss your chance to apply today for @BrowardCounty's small business & non-profit grants for assistance if you have been affected by COVID. The deadline is November 16th:https://t.co/WpzhDwxMEq

I stand with @RepDWStweets urging @GovRonDeSantis to remove @kylamb8 as a data analyst to the Florida OPB. As cases of COVID surge in our state we need qualified people who believe in science public health guidance and doing all we can to keep residents safe. https://t.co/UEBf0o36yy

Florida is hitting it's highest rates of COVID-19. We can flatten the curve and save lives by wearing masks following public health and social distancing guidelines. Together we can defeat this. For more information: https://t.co/I0BGN3RkZF

The US has now surpassed a grim record of 10M cases of COVID-19. We have lost 230000 fellow Americans. We must listen to the experts wear masks and take the proper precautions to get this ongoing pandemic under control. If we work together we can defeat this. https://t.co/4mJQCqZ5Uy

If you are a small business with 20 employees or less OR a non-profit with 25 employees or less the @browardcounty CARES Act is offering working capital grants to those affected by COVID-19. Application information and submissions can be found at: https://t.co/WpzhDwxMEq

@pbcgov is extending the deadline for Florida residents who have lost income due to COVID to apply for up to $10000 in rent assistance and $1200 in utility relief through the @pbccsd under the CARES Act. You can apply at https://t.co/WFFNISIIRq up until NOV 16th.

COVID-19 cases are surging daily in Florida & across the country. I joined @RepLoisFrankel urging @GovRonDesantis in extending the executive order expiring on Nov 1st allowing local govt officials to conduct business utilizing virtual media to maintain the safety of residents.

#NEW: @COVIDOversight releases interim staff report on investigations into the Trump Administration’s failed coronavirus pandemic response among the “worst failures of leadership in American history.” Read the full release ⬇️  https://t.co/pIqR9MDVHv https://t.co/MWOTXQ5vv3

As the country is ravaged by the deadly Coronavirus the new relief bill is stalled in negotiations as @realDonaldtrump & Republicans brush aside scientific data & testing to navigate the pandemic while many Americans & hospitals remain in desperate need of relief & assistance.

It has been 11 years since the Hate Crimes Prevention Act passed. Today as our country faces social injustices amidst the Coronavirus pandemic we must denounce such crimes of bigotry hatred racism & anti-Semitism to create a more inclusive country celebrating our differences.

@CityofTamarac has opened it's 4th round of residential assistance during the on-going pandemic of COVID-19. If you are struggling to meet everyday needs like rent mortgage emergency repair and more apply at https://t.co/klv0oyAwu3.

Private White House reports obtained by @COVIDOversight show that ALL 50 states need more testing. That's why the updated House-passed #HeroesAct includes $75 billion for testing tracing & isolation measures. The Senate must act to save lives and livelihoods!

October 20-28th @browardcounty issues an emergency order extending consumption of food & alcohol on-premise by one hour til midnight for all establishments. No dine-in between 12-5 am. Social distancing & facial coverings still remain in effect 2 prevent the spread of COVID-19.

I stand with my colleagues to honor the @WFP for their 2020 @NobelPrize. H.Res. 1191 affirms the WFP’s mission as the world's largest humanitarian organization fighting the hunger pandemic ESP during COVID-19 where hunger cases have surged. https://t.co/CgzVnm8iVN

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP 2) is now open for enrollment until December 11th. More information and requirements can be found at https://t.co/DblescbyFF or by calling the national call center 877-508-8364.

Unprecedented times don't have to be experienced alone. @BrowardCounty offers assistance through the Vulnerable Population Registry providing services during difficult times like COVID-19 such as food delivery. To register https://t.co/3KPlO248us

The City of Lauderhill has been awarded $519251 to provide households that have experienced income loss due to COVID grants for rent and utilities. To apply & find out how to qualify: https://t.co/9rzXtrSRAJ

The #COVID19 pandemic is FUELING a housing crisis. Millions of Americans are facing EVICTION. #KnowYour Rights. Find out if you qualify for protection from eviction. Visit https://t.co/1tcxtTr8U7 for more information. https://t.co/j3RvIJlOy9

Over a thousand new cases of COVID in FL from Sunday-Monday while @realDonaldTrump  holds a rally in Sanford with many in no masks including himself and @GovRonDeSantis. This behavior shows no regard for the safety of our state and nation.

The President not only continues to endanger the health of those around him but also the lives of millions of Americans who are suffering due to this pandemic. Today he pulled the plug on COVID relief negotiations until after the election. This is absolutely shameful! https://t.co/MF0cjmxfKy

@realdonaldtrump not only continues to endanger the health of those around him but also the lives of millions of Americans who are suffering due to this pandemic. Today he pulled the plug on COVID relief negotiations until after the election. This is absolutely shameful! https://t.co/MF0cjmxfKy

Today I led FL Democrats in calling on @GovRonDeSantis to extend waivers for #SNAP #TANF & #Medicaid until FL has fully recovered from the #COVID19 & economic downturn. It is too soon to be withdrawing support and relief to children and families during an ongoing pandemic. https://t.co/IqNjCQ0mpl

COVID-19 is the latest in a long line of animal-borne epidemics. We must act now to prevent the next outbreak. That’s why I’m working to  #PreventFuturePandemics by cracking down on wildlife trade/markets and improving global food systems to reduce demand for wildlife as food. https://t.co/n1YNytEeVi

As Harvest season beings the safety of our Florida farmers is important as they feed over 150M Americans. Commissioner @nikkifried in partnership with @FLSERT & @UF_IFAS announces free COVID testing for the essential workers in Agricultural counties of FL to keep them safe. https://t.co/W02K2jkgOG

A good foster home is vital for children. With the impact of COVID-19 a safe environment is more important than ever. I’m proud 2 stand with @DrNealDunnFL2 for the C.H.I.L.D. Act which provides the necessary resources for home environments for families and children in need.

A vote for Amy Coney Barrett is a vote to end healthcare for millions of Americans and make healthcare out of reach for millions more with preexisting conditions all while the President callously continues to ignore the COVID-19 pandemic.

Palm Beach County is lucky to have @imtammy1 & @gotglades. Their efforts help provide food distribution COVID testing sites while lobbying for the needs of Belle Glade Pahokee and South Bay residents: https://t.co/VC5TFnNrsg

As we mark #HispanicHeritageMonth amid the COVID-19 pandemic we acknowledge that Latinx and Hispanic workers have proven more essential than ever despite facing added risks. This month let us honor the important contributions of the Latinx and Hispanic community to our nation. https://t.co/S0XtaTdUVZ

By passing the #HeroesAct @HouseDemocrats did something President Trump has failed to do- #LEAD. 118 days ago Democrats passed the #HeroesAct legislation that responds to the #COVID19 pandemic by supporting states territories and localities. #SaveOurStates https://t.co/82EUwahIGM

3/19 12600 confirmed cases in US 265 confirmed deaths in US  Today 6334150+ confirmed cases in US 189970+ confirmed deaths in US  How many lives could've been saved if Trump had actually been honest about the danger posed by COVID?  #TrumpKnew & did nothing but bury the facts https://t.co/OZkGQWHelO

The @SenateGOP must pass the Heroes Act! https://t.co/zDfFSmX0Cc

For details and to apply visit https://t.co/VwkDn57Byo or call 954-831-2380. https://t.co/H7PhMd4suA

Broward County residents: @BrowardInfo has approved an online program to assist with unpaid rent due to COVID. $25M of #CARESAct funding will be made available for CARES Act Rental Assistance. Apply between 8/31 - 9/6 online & learn more at https://t.co/0Q8RfArMDx

Universal access to COVID testing is key to defeating the virus & protecting our communities. This is why I cosponsored @RepDMP’s & @WhipClyburn’s MOTION Act to expand access to mobile testing for those unable to use traditional testing sites.

August is #BlackBusinessMonth. We know the economic toll of COVID-19 has hit businesses—especially those that are minority-owned particularly hard. While Congress has set aside aid for underserved communities we must do more to support #Blackbusinesses https://t.co/BBCUjOb1U6

Proud to #MakeCOVIDReliefWork & cosponsor HR7691 the Mixed Earner Pandemic #Unemployment Assistance Act to ensure that hardworking Americans with mixed income such as gig workers & freelancers receive the full & proper benefits they deserve to make rent & feed their families.

Given the added risks of contracting COVID-19 during prolonged or unsafe detention we need to follow @UN guidance to protect the health of enforcement officers & immigrants. There’s no 1-size-fits-all solution for communities battling COVID-19. Yet despite the spiking cases in FL @GovRonDeSantis has required all schools to reopen. FL Members & I are urging a re-evaluation of this policy for the sake of FL teachers students & families #ReopenSafely https://t.co/v3tmnpcDU7

The COVID-19 pandemic thrusted us into an almost entirely virtual world. However not everyone has access to high speed #internet especially in rural areas. On this #RuralBroadbandDay I will continue to fight for universal access to this vital service. https://t.co/cBndYd8aWu

The second minibus for fiscal year 2021 #appropriations was passed today and consists of six annual spending bills. These bills make important investments that are critical to the wellbeing of our nation during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/tkS0oaQIaB

As FL becomes a COVID-19 hotspot we are still facing a nat’l shortage of PPE. Once again @realDonaldTrump proves inept in all matters of the Presidency.
